info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.signup
info.description:
Use this API to signup for F5XC service.
one can signup to use volterra service as an individual/free account or
as a team account more suited for enterprise customers. 
for more details on what each type of account features, visit - https://console.ves.volterra.io/signup/usage_plan
since signup flow includes more complex selections and passing in secure payment processing,
we recommend using web UI for this process https://console.ves.volterra.io/signup/start

get.description: Returns a list of known states of a country. List will be empty if country has no states.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description:
country code

x-example: "US"
2 characters country code as described in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1, column `alpha-2`

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description:
Prefix

x-example: "AL for Alabama"
first two or more characters of the state you look for (can be upper or lower case)

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

state code

x-example: "TN"
2 characters country code as described in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2:US/CA/IN, column `code`, excluding the leading country code

parameters.name: prefix

Prefix

x-example: "DE"
first two or more characters of the city you look for (can be upper or lower case)

get.description: Get allows users to query signup and its status. Use this to query for a status of a submitted signup object.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Signup name

x-example: "signup-1234-5678-9012-3456"
Name of the signup we want to retrieve . The name is returned after a signup object submission.

post.description:
It validates that:
* the provided country and zip code are not empty
* the provided country is in the configured list of countries
* a provided zip code matches a regexp for a given country

contactContactType.description:
Determines the contact type

Indicates snail mail address (used for correspondence)
Indicates billing address (this address will appear on invoices)
Indicates contact used for a payment method (this address is used when charging a payment method)
contactContactType.title: Contact Type

bandwidth_max_mb.description:
Bandwidth max allowed for a customer defined by contract

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 9999
bandwidth_max_mb.title: Bandwidth Max

schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.description: BlindfoldSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by F5XC Secret Management
schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.title: BlindfoldSecretInfoType

decryption_provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Secret Management service.

Example: ` "value"`
decryption_provider.title: Decryption Provider

location.description:
Location is the uri_ref. It could be in url format for string:///
 Or it could be a path if the store provider is an http/https location

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
location.title: Location

store_provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "value"`
store_provider.title: Store Provider

schemaClearSecretInfoType.description: ClearSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret that is not encrypted.
schemaClearSecretInfoType.title: ClearSecretInfoType

provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "box-provider"`
provider.title: Provider

url.description:
URL of the secret. Currently supported URL schemes is string:///.
 For string:/// scheme, Secret needs to be encoded Base64 format.
 When asked for this secret, caller will get Secret bytes after Base64 decoding.

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
url.title: URL

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status
hostname.title: hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated
last_update_time.title: last_update_time

reason.description:
x-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
 A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status
service_name.title: service name

status.description:
Status of the condition
 "Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
 "Failed"  Validation has failed.
 "Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
 "Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
 "Down" Configuration is operationally down. e.g. down interface
 "Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. ObjectMetaType.Disable = true.
 "NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs

Example: ` "Failed"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Success\",\"Failed\",\"Incomplete\",\"Installed\",\"Down\",\"Disabled\",\"NotApplicable\"]
status.title: status

type.description:
Type of the condition
 "Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
 "Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object

Example: ` "Operational"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Validation\",\"Operational\"]
type.title: type

schemaEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
schemaEmpty.title: Empty

schemaInitializerType.description: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.
schemaInitializerType.title: InitializerType

name.description: name of the service that is responsible for initializing this object.
name.title: name

schemaInitializersType.description: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization of a configuration object
schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.
pending.title: pending

schemaObjectMetaType.description:
ObjectMetaType is metadata(common attributes) of an object that all configuration objects will have.
The information in this type can be specified by user during create and replace APIs.
schemaObjectMetaType.title: ObjectMetaType

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
 set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
 queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 64
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 1024
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.min_len: 1
annotations.title: annotations

description.description:
Human readable description for the object

Example: ` "Virtual Host for acmecorp website"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 1200
description.title: description

disable.description:
A value of true will administratively disable the object

Example: ` "true"`
disable.title: disable

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the user. Values specified here will be used
 by selector expression

Example: ` "value"`
labels.title: labels

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
 It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

Example: ` "acmecorp-web"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
name.title: name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
 Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

Example: ` "staging"`
namespace.title: namespace

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. Object create will fail if
 provided by the client and the value exists in the system. Typically generated by the
 server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change once populated.
 Shadowed by SystemObjectMeta's uid field.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
schemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) uid.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaSecretEncodingType.description:
x-displayName: "Secret Encoding"
SecretEncodingType defines the encoding type of the secret before handled by the Secret Management Service.

 - EncodingNone: x-displayName: "None"
No Encoding
 - EncodingBase64: Base64

x-displayName: "Base64"
Base64 encoding
schemaSecretEncodingType.title: SecretEncodingType

schemaSecretType.description: SecretType is used in an object to indicate a sensitive/confidential field
schemaSecretType.title: SecretType

schemaStatusMetaType.description: StatusMetaType is metadata that all status must have.
schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
 for latest status object from same origin
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
 This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.

Example: ` "ver.re1.int.ves.io"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
 identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
 information

Example: ` "ver-instance-1"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

status_id.description:
status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
 objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
 daemon(creator-id)
status_id.title: status_id

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

 - STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
 - STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSyncMode.description:
Sync mode is to specify where the user details are being synced from.

 - SELF: Self
System managed user.
 - SCIM: SCIM
SCIM synced user. Full user life cycle is managed by the SCIM provider.
schemaSyncMode.title: Sync Mode

schemaSystemObjectMetaType.description:
SystemObjectMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectMetaType.title: SystemObjectMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_cookie.description:
This can used by the creator of the object for later audit for e.g. by storing the
 version identifying information of the object so at future it can be determined if
 version present at remote end is current or stale.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_cookie.title: creator_cookie

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

direct_ref_hash.description:
A hash of the UIDs of  direct references on this object. This can be used to determine if 
 this object hash has had references become resolved/unresolved
direct_ref_hash.title: direct_ref_hash

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

namespace.description:
The namespace this object belongs to. This is populated by the service based on the
 metadata.namespace field when an object is created.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 1
namespace.title: namespace

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

revision.description:
A revision number which always increases with each modification of the object in storage
 This doesn't necessarily increase sequentially, but should always increase.
 This will be 0 when first created, and before any modifications.
revision.title: revision

sre_disable.description:
This should be set to true If VES/SRE operator wants to suppress an object from being
 presented to business-logic of a daemon(e.g. due to bad-form/issue-causing Object).
 This is meant only to be used in temporary situations for operational continuity till
 a fix is rolled out in business-logic.

Example: ` "true"`
sre_disable.title: sre_disable

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

trace_info.description:
trace_info holds information(<trace-id>:<span-id>:<parent-span-id>) of the request doing
 the object modification. This can be used on the watch side to create subsequent spans.
 This information can be used to co-relate activities across services (modulo state compression)
 for a synchronous API.

Example: ` "value"`
trace_info.title: trace_info

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaTaxExemptionType.description:
TaxExemptionType holds possible tax exemption option.

UNKNOWN indicates the field not being set
TAX_REGULAR indicates customers that are required to pay taxes
TAX_EXEMPT indicates customers exempt from paying taxes - their status needs to be verified once signup is completed.
TAX_EXEMPT indicates customers exempt from paying taxes - their status has been verified and the customer is not being taxed by us.
TAX_EXEMPT_VERIFICATION_FAILED indicates customers that the tax exempt verification process failed - they can contact F5XC to get more details
TAX_EXEMPT_VERIFICATION_PENDING indicates customers that the tax exempt verification process is ongoing
schemaTaxExemptionType.title: TaxExemptionType

schemaTenantType.description:
TenantType is the type of the customer

UNKNOWN indicates the field not being set
FREEMIUM are customer that don't have their domain
ENTERPRiISE customer have their domain
schemaTenantType.title: TenantType

schemaVaultSecretInfoType.description:
x-displayName: "Vault Secret"
VaultSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by Hashicorp Vault.
schemaVaultSecretInfoType.title: VaultSecretInfoType

key.description:
x-displayName: "Key"
x-example: "key_pem"
Key of the individual secret. Vault Secrets are stored as key-value pair.
If user is only interested in one value from the map, this field should be set to the corresponding key.
If not provided entire secret will be returned.
key.title: Key

location.description:
x-displayName: "Location"
x-required
x-example: "v1/data/vhost_key"
Path to secret in Vault.
location.title: Location

provider.description:
x-displayName: "Provider"
x-required
x-example: "vault-vh-provider"
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Vault.
provider.title: Provider

version.description:
x-displayName: "Version"
x-example: "1"
Version of the secret to be fetched. As vault secrets are versioned, user can specify this field to fetch specific version.
If not provided latest version will be returned.
version.title: Version

schemaViewRefType.description: ViewRefType represents a reference to a view
schemaViewRefType.title: ViewRefType

kind.description:
Kind of the view object

Example: ` "http_proxy"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

uid.description:
UID of the view object

Example: ` "f3744323-1adf-4aaa-a5dc-0707c1d1bd82"`
uid.title: uid

schemaWingmanSecretInfoType.description:
x-displayName: "Wingman Secret"
WingmanSecretInfoType specifies the handle to the wingman secret
schemaWingmanSecretInfoType.title: WingmanSecretInfoType

name.description:
x-displayName: "Name"
x-required
x-example: "ChargeBack-API-Key"
Name of the secret.
name.title: Name

schemacontactGlobalSpecType.description:
Instance of one single contact that can be used to communicate with customers.
Depending on contact type we use these details to send general communication (regular, physical mail) or invoices.
schemacontactGlobalSpecType.title: Contact

prefixes.description:
List of tenant 'super' prefixes noted in CIDR

Example: ` "value"`
prefixes.title: prefixes

primary_network_name.description:
Name of the default customer network

Example: ` "defensenet_local"`
primary_network_name.title: Primary Network Name

schemasignupErrorCode.description:
ErrorCode is used to know the specific reason for signup registration failures

 - ETOKEN_OK: token related codes go here
 - EUSER_OK: user related codes go here
 - ECONTACT_VALIDATE_OK: contact validation codes go here
Validation is ok
 - ECONTACT_EMPTY_COUNTRY: Empty country during validation of a contact
 - ECONTACT_EMPTY_ZIP_CODE: Empty zip code during validation of a contact
 - ECONTACT_UNKNOWN_COUNTRY: A given country is not present in the configured list of country-zipCodeRegexp
 - ECONTACT_INVALID_ZIP: A given zip doesn't match a configured regexp for a given country
 - EOK: EOK indicates no error
 - ENO_STATES: ENO_STATES indicates no states in a country
 - ENO_CITIES: ENO_CITIES indicates no cities in country/state
schemasignupErrorCode.title: error code

billing_provider_account_id.description:
Id of the billing provider account created to verify the billing info provided with this object.
 The id is then used to ensure no more duplicate billing account is created.
billing_provider_account_id.title: billing_provider_account_id

currency.description:
preferred currency on the tenant level - individual billing accounts may
 override this.

Example: ` "USD"`
currency.title: currency

domain.description:
domain the customer chose to use - enterprise customers only.

Example: ` "value"`
domain.title: domain

email.description:
email of the customer (ideally someone who's responsible for the company
 account)
 obsolete

Example: ` "customer@email.com"`
email.title: email

first_name.description:
first name of the customer
 obsolete

Example: ` "John"`
first_name.title: first_name

last_name.description:
last name of the customer (the superuser)
 obsolete

Example: ` "Doe"`
last_name.title: last_name

locale.description:
locale of this sign up

Example: ` "en-us"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
locale.title: locale

payment_provider_token.description:
payment provider token (for credit card details)

Example: ` "tok_1234567890"`
payment_provider_token.title: payment_provider_token

support_plan_name.description:
what sort of support plan the customer will be on.

Example: ` "xxxx-yyyy-zzzz-1111"`
support_plan_name.title: support_plan_name

token.description:
token of the user requesting for.
 Valid tokens are internally generated in the system and shared with respective customers.
 Onboarding of new customers will proceed only when a valid token along with the email is provided during the signup process.

Example: ` "tok_1234567890"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
token.title: token of the user

tos_accepted.description:
t&c accepted date as millis from 01/01/1970 UTC

Example: ` "1569926163000"`
tos_accepted.title: tos_accepted

tos_version.description:
indicates the version of ToS customer approved during signup. Any new version will require the customer to re-approve during login.

Example: ` "v1.2"`
tos_version.title: version of terms of services the customer accepted

usage_plan_name.description:
what sort of usage plan the customer will be on.

Example: ` "xxxx-yyyy-zzzz-1111"`
usage_plan_name.title: usage_plan_name

domain_owner.description:
Domain owner is the first user who registered or signed up the associated Tenant.
 User created via signup flow will have this value set to true.
 Few restrictions apply to this user w.r.t role update and deletion.

Example: ` "true"`
domain_owner.title: Domain Owner

last_login_timestamp.description: Last successful login timestamp of the user.
last_login_timestamp.title: last_login_timestamp

locale.description:
locale of the user (defaults to English)

Example: ` "value"`
locale.title: locale

tos_accepted.description:
tos accepted version, this field is deprecated refer the fields `tos_accepted_at` and `tos_version` instead.

Example: ` "1.0"`
tos_accepted.title: tos_accepted

The name of the configuration object to be fetched. Is not used for now.

signupValidateContactResponse.description:
ValidateRegistrationResponse is the response that indicates if the contact is valid or not.
If the contact is not valid, a corresponding error code is returned.
A list of supported validation is provided under Validate rpc call documentation.
signupValidateContactResponse.title: Response to validate contact

is_valid.description:
flag indicates if the contact is valid

Example: ` "true"`
is_valid.title: Is a valid contact

validation_errors.description:
x-displayName : "Validation errors"
 collection of validation errors
validation_errors.title: validation errors

signupValidateRegistrationRequest.description: ValidateRegistrationRequest is the request body parameeters required to validate the registration
signupValidateRegistrationRequest.title: Request to validate registration

email.description:
email of the user requesting for

Example: ` "admin@email.com"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
email.title: email of the user

token.description:
token of the user requesting for

Example: ` "value"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
token.title: token of the user

signupValidateRegistrationResponse.description:
ValidateRegistrationResponse is the response that indicates if the registration is valid or not.
For a brand new registration, the valid_registration is set to true that indicates that signup flow can flow through.
In case of an existing user, the valid_registration is set to false.
signupValidateRegistrationResponse.title: Response to validate registration

valid_registration.description:
valid registration flag indicates if the registration is valid

Example: ` "true"`
valid_registration.title: Valid registration

signupValidationErrorField.description: Contains information on a single validation error
signupValidationErrorField.title: Validation error field

error_field.description:
path indicates the field that is not valid

Example: ` "zip_code"`
error_field.title: Error field

error_message.description:
more descriptive error message

Example: ` "Zip code should be a 000-00000 format"`
error_message.title: Error message
error_message.x-ves-example: Zip code should be a 000-00000 format

userFSMState.description:
States describes possible states for user.

 - StateUndefined: StateUndefined

User state when it was created without any state.
 - StateCreating: StateCreating

User state during initial creation. It includes registering in IDM, creating user-settings object, etc...
 - StateCreateFailed: StateCreateFailed

User state when initial creation was failed by some reason and must be retried
after issue is solved.
 - StateActive: StateActive

User state of completely created and available to use user.
 - StateDisabled: StateDisabled

User is currently disabled, login is not possible for this user, but it may become active again in the future.
userFSMState.title: States

userIdmType.description:
IdmType is to identify who is managing the user.

 - SSO: SSO User
Externally managed Single Sign On based user imported into UAM.
 - VOLTERRA_MANAGED: F5XC Managed Local user
F5XC managed local user. Full user life cycle is managed by volterra UAM and Identity.
 - UNDEFINED: Undefined
Undefined IDM type
userIdmType.title: IDM Type

userUserType.description:
UserType is to identify the type of user

 - USER: User
Regular User
 - SERVICE: Service User
User for accessing only APIs/services
 - DEBUG: Debug
User which was created by tenant admin for volterra-support team.
userUserType.title: UserType
